body: You can do anything, but not everything.
author: David Allen

body: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

body: The richest man is not he who has the most, but he who needs the least.
author: Unknown Author

body: You miss 100 percent of the shots you never take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

body: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear.
author: Ambrose Redmoon

body: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Gandhi

body: When hungry, eat your rice; when tired, close your eyes. Fools may laugh at me, but wise men will know what I mean.
author: Lin-chi

body: The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking.
author: A. A. Milne

body: To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

body: We are what we repeatedly do; excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

body: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends
author: Baltasar Gracian

body: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old; seek what they sought.
author: Basho

body: Everyone is a genius at least once a year. The real geniuses simply have their bright ideas closer together.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

body: What we think, or what we know, or what we believe is, in the end, of little consequence. The only consequence is what we do.
author: John Ruskin

body: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new lands but seeing with new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

body: Work like you don’t need money, love like you’ve never been hurt, and dance like no one’s watching
author: Unknown Author

body: Try a thing you haven’t done three times. Once, to get over the fear of doing it. Twice, to learn how to do it. And a third time, to figure out whether you like it or not.
author: Virgil Garnett Thomson

body: Even if you’re on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

body: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing – that’s why we recommend it daily.
author: Zig Ziglar

body: What the world needs is more geniuses with humility, there are so few of us left.
author: Oscar Levant

body: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

body: The person who reads too much and uses his brain too little will fall into lazy habits of thinking.
author: Albert Einstein

body: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

body: We learn something every day, and lots of times it’s that what we learned the day before was wrong.
author: Bill Vaughan

body: Don’t ever wrestle with a pig. You’ll both get dirty, but the pig will enjoy it.
author: Cale Yarborough

body: An inventor is simply a fellow who doesn’t take his education too seriously.
author: Charles F. Kettering

body: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Ellen Parr

body: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you’re still a rat.
author: Lily Tomlin

body: Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else’s can shorten it.
author: Cullen Hightower
